Idiom (Yucatec Maya): Mix ts'aik ja'ab, mix túulil ts'onot
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Fixed negative clause with parallel structure
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: If you don't contribute, you don't benefit
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yucatec May: miʃ tsaːik xaʔab miʃ tuːlil tsoːnot
First Example Sentence: Mix ts'aik ja'ab, mix túulil ts'onot, ku yáantik le máak u jantaj.
Second Example Sentence: Mix ts'aik ja'ab, mix túulil ts'onot, tu men ku na'at u beetiko'ob.
Third Example Sentence: Mix ts'aik ja'ab, mix túulil ts'onot, túun le meyajo'ob mix ts'a'ik k'áat.

Idiom (Yucatec Maya): Le báaxal taan k'áat u tsikbal
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They are trying to stir up problems
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Game-based expression from Maya family life
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yucatec May: le ɓaːʃal taːn kaʔat u tsikɓal
First Example Sentence: Le báaxal taan k'áat u tsikbal tu yóok'ol in wóol.
Second Example Sentence: Le báaxal taan k'áat u tsikbal ku na'atik u yóok'ol in wóol.
Third Example Sentence: Túun le báaxal taan k'áat u tsikbal ku jant-aj le k'i'ik'el.

Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Based on common frustration with being ignored
First Example Sentence: Ba'ax ku t'aan u xikin le x-ch'úupal mix bin u na'at.
Second Example Sentence: Ba'ax ku t'aan u xikin, ma' ku yila' u jats'uts t'aan.
Third Example Sentence: Ba'ax ku t'aan u xikin, le nojoch máak ku náach tu ka'aj.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Someone is acting dangerously or arrogantly
First Example Sentence: Le máak u ch'íik u báalam, ku beetik ba'ax ma' tu yóok'ol.
Second Example Sentence: U ch'íik u báalam tu men mix na'at ba'ax ku k'áat u beetik.
Third Example Sentence: Le máak ku ch'íik u báalam, ku náach u ximbalo'ob tu yóok'ol.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: One’s words are misunderstood or twisted
First Example Sentence: Le t'aan u tsol ti' le máak ku ts'a'ik ch'íich'.
Second Example Sentence: U tsol u t'aan, ba'ale' ma' tu ch'och' le puksi'ik'al.
Third Example Sentence: Le t'aan u tsol, ku ya'al u yóok'ol ba'ax mix na'at.

Idiom (Yucatec Maya): Le che' ku túun le ché'en
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Looks similar but is very different inside
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Looks the same, but is not the same
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Visual metaphor using wood and tree imagery
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yucatec May: le tʃeʔ ku tuːn le tʃéʔen
First Example Sentence: Le che' ku túun le ché'en, ba'ale' mix ts'o'ok u ya'ab.
Second Example Sentence: Le che' ku túun le ché'en, ka' le ku jats'uts u yila'.
Third Example Sentence: Le che' ku túun le ché'en, ba'ale' ku yila' ma' le bey xan.

Idiom (Yucatec Maya): U k'áat u janal ichil k'áax
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yucatec May: u kaʔat u hanal itʃʰil kaʔaʃ
First Example Sentence: U k'áat u janal ichil k'áax bey xan u na'at.
Second Example Sentence: Le máak ku k'áat u janal ichil k'áax ku jant-aj ba'ax ma' to'on.
Third Example Sentence: U k'áat u janal ichil k'áax, ba'ale' ku náach tu xikin.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Appears clean but has bad intentions
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Moral tales referencing appearance vs. reality
First Example Sentence: Ma' tu ch'och', tu yóok'ol le máak ku p'at le jach utsil.
Second Example Sentence: Ma' tu ch'och', tu yóok'ol ba'ax ku beetik mix jats'uts.
Third Example Sentence: Tu ch'och', ba'ale' tu yóok'ol le k'i'ik'el.

Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: They said something to cause trouble

Second Example Sentence: In ch'a'ik u t'aan yéetel le nojoch k'áak', túun ku xok u yila'.
Third Example Sentence: In ch'a'ik u t'aan yéetel le nojoch k'áak' tu chi le ch'íich'.
